description.narrative: (i) Contribution to the Development of the Ivoirian Poultry Industry: IFC investment will support the Company''s efforts to promote higher efficiency, quality, and best practice biosecurity standards. These best practices would spread throughout the country, and contribute to development of Ivorian poultry industry. (ii) Benefit to the supply chain: SIPRA operates in a post conflict country with significant linkages to farmers and MSMEs. SIPRA works with 25 poultry outgrower farms. Also, SIPRA sources maize locally reaching small farmers, and sells its feed and day-old chicks to poultry meat and egg farmers. The Company indirectly contribute the growth of small service-oriented businesses (transporters, restaurants, etc.). (iii) Employment creation: The Company has 523 full-time employees and 217 temporary workers. The Project is estimated to create approximately 200 additional jobs. (iv) Increased Tax Revenue For Government. (v) Demonstration effect: IFC investment in Cote d''Ivoire will raise confidence of other investors.

IFC is considering to invest up to 7 million to support the expansion of La Societe Ivoirienne de Productions Animales (SIPRA or the Company), a leading poultry operator based in Cote dIvoire. SIPRA has vertically integrated operations established in three key business units, namely 1) Ivoire Poussins, which encompass parent stock farms and hatchery for production of one day-old chick, and commercial farming facilities composed of 4 egg laying farms, and 34 broiler chickens farms, including 9 under SIPRAs management and 25 contracted farms; 2) Ivograin, a feed mill unit. Ivograin is also selling its products through a network of 22 retail outlets throughout Ivory Coast; and, 3) CoqIvoire, a slaughtering unit and 43 retailing outlets for chicken and eggs. IFCs financing will be used for SIPRAs 22 million expansion project (the Project) over the next 3 years. The Project includes: (i) expand broiler production to 8 million birds p.a.; (ii) expand egg production to 70 million eggs p.a. (from current 20 million eggs); (iii) increase poultry & egg retail outlets to 80 (from current 43); (iv) debottlenecking of feedmill to increase capacity; and (v) others (working capital, etc.).
